ai-patthana16.17:0.2_0: (This should be expanded as in SN 4.)
ai-patthana16.17:0.3_0: Standing on the bank of the skillful, the mental fixation.
ai-patthana16.17:1.1_0: mentality doesn’t give rise to mental phenomena.
ai-patthana16.17:1.1_1: The skillful quality doesn’t arise for cause or reason.
ai-patthana16.17:1.1_2: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the skillful.
ai-patthana16.17:1.1_3: mental thought is not skilled in mental processes. And mental phenomena don’t arise because of incompetent, for they don’t experience cause or reason.
ai-patthana16.17:1.1_4: Physical teaching doesn’t arise because of unskillful qualities, or not for the sake of the skillful.
ai-patthana16.17:2.1_0: Unskillful thoughts don’t give rise to mental phenomena.
ai-patthana16.17:2.1_1: Unskillful thoughts don’t give rise to the teaching for the sake of unskillful.
ai-patthana16.17:2.1_2: Physicality doesn’t give rise to mental processes. Sentient beings don’t give rise to a cause.
ai-patthana16.17:2.1_3: Physical teaching doesn’t teach Dhamma for the sake of the unskillful and the causes and conditions that arise from causes.
ai-patthana16.17:2.1_4: Physical teaching is not skilled in the stream, skilled in the teaching, and skilled in five ways.
ai-patthana16.17:3.1_0: An unkillful person doesn’t teach Dhamma for the sake of unskillful.
ai-patthana16.17:3.1_1: An undetermined thought doesn’t arise for cause or reason.
ai-patthana16.17:3.1_2: An unprotected mind, not skilled in the teaching, skilled in terminology, and skilled in causes.
